{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.04919v1", "title": "Isomorphism Theorems for Impartial Combinatorial Games", "summary": "We introduce the category of optiongraphs and option preserving maps as a
model to study impartial combinatorial games. Outcomes, remoteness, and
extended nim-values are preserved under option preserving maps. We show that
the four isomorphism theorems from universal algebra are valid in this
category. Quotient optiongraphs, including the minimum quotient, provide
simplifications that can help in the analysis of games.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-05-08T03:27:28Z"}
